intro: Cheilotheca sleumerana, commonly known as the slender-leaved thistle, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and hairy stems. The plant features narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine, white hairs. Its flowers are small and yellow, arranged in dense clusters, and it produces small, oval-shaped fruits. Cheilotheca sleumerana is typically found in rocky or alpine habitats and is adapted to cool, moist environments.
